# hitachi_vsp_one_servers (Data Source)

Data source to list servers in VSP One Block.

## Example Usage

```terraform
#
# Hitachi VSP One Servers List Retrieval
#
# This section defines a data source block that retrieves a list of all servers
# managed by Hitachi storage systems through the Virtual Storage Platform One
# Block Administrator.
#
# The "hitachi_vsp_one_servers" data source allows you to access information about
# all configured servers in the storage system, enabling you to reference server
# details in Terraform configurations and automate resource dependencies.
#
# This data source is particularly useful for discovering available servers
# before creating server-specific configurations or for inventory management.
#

data "hitachi_vsp_one_servers" "all_servers" {
  serial = 12345
}

output "servers_list" {
  value = data.hitachi_vsp_one_servers.all_servers
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `serial` (Number) The serial number of the storage.

### Optional

- `hba_wwn` (String) HBA WWN (exact match). If specified, the list will be filtered by the specified conditions.
- `iscsi_name` (String) iSCSI name (exact match). If specified, the list will be filtered by the specified conditions.
- `nickname` (String) Server nickname (exact match). If specified, the list will be filtered by the specified conditions.
- `server_count` (Number) Number of items stored in data.

### Read-Only

- `data` (List of Object) List of server information. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--data))
- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.

<a id="nestedatt--data"></a>
### Nested Schema for `data`

Read-Only:

- `has_unaligned_os_types` (Boolean)
- `is_inconsistent` (Boolean)
- `is_reserved` (Boolean)
- `modification_in_progress` (Boolean)
- `nickname` (String)
- `number_of_paths` (Number)
- `os_type` (String)
- `protocol` (String)
- `server_id` (Number)
- `total_capacity` (Number)
- `used_capacity` (Number)
